About Me Projects Resume

NICE TO MEET YOU...

My name is Brennen and I am a computer science student at the University of Kentucky. I started out programming making games for my friends to play when I was in 7th grade. Since then this craft has became my passion and hopefully soon my profession. Currently, I spend most my time tinkering with electronics and learning more about web apps. However, I am open to all types of learning and make it my goal every day to learn something new. I hope you enjoy this website I put together and please reach out for more information!

I'm a Wildcat...

University of Kentucky

Class of 2023 (expected)

Work Experience:

University of Kentucky Department of Communication, Technical Developer Current
My role as a technical developer to help enable researchers through building various data gather applications. On top of this I server as a first responder for any immedieate technical issues from printers, to projectors for the department.
University of Kentucky Cancer Center, Bioinformatics Research Assistant (August 2018 - December 2018)
While working as a member of the lab I got to work within a Linux work environment which allowed me to learn how to harness the power of unix-based operating systems. My main role on the team was to focus on learning as much about programming as I could through the use of weekly code critiques and programming projects based around bioinformatics. The projects I contributed were written entirely in Python but also required me to read over and comprehend codebases written in other languages such as Java.
Change Force Corporation, Web Developer (October 2017 - May 2018)
As the sole web developer on our small team my job was to role out a fully functional first website for the non-profit using mostly Wordpress This position also allowed me to tinker with PHP for the first time and also CRM tools and SQL the most beneficial part of this position was being able to learn how to communicate technical information with a non-technical team.
